clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Lower Tourniquet Pressure During Total Knee Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy of Using Lower Tourniquet Pressure During Total Knee Arthroplasty: Comparison With Conventional Tourniquet Pressure Group

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to determine whether the lower tourniquet pressure, which is set by adding 120mmHg (millimeter of mercury) on the systolic blood pressure just before tourniquet inflation, are efficient and safe during total knee arthroplasty, compared with the conventional tourniquet pressure: 150mmHg above the systolic blood pressure before tourniquet inflation.

detailed_description.textblock: We will compare the two groups of patients undergoing total knee arthroplasty, which the tourniquet pressure will be set differently: systolic blood pressure plus 120mmHg vs. systolic blood pressure plus 150mmHg, the conventional method, in terms of efficacy and safety.

primary_outcome.measure: Acquisition of bloodless surgical field just after skin incision
primary_outcome.time_frame: just after skin incision during operation
primary_outcome.description: Dichotomous variable determined during operation by operator (Yes or No)

secondary_outcome.measure: Failure of acquiring bloodless surgical field during operation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: after skin incision through the point of tourniquet deflation

secondary_outcome.measure: Increasement of tourniquet pressure to acquire bloodless surgical field
secondary_outcome.time_frame: after skin incision though the point of tourniquet deflation
secondary_outcome.description: We will increase the tourniquet pressure by 30mmHg from the initial tourniquet pressure, if we will fail to achieve bloodless surgical field during operation. The increasement of tourniquet pressure will be recorded if it will be needed during operation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Thigh pain on the site of tourniquet application
secondary_outcome.description: measured by 11-point numerical visual analog scale (VAS)and 5-Likert scale
measured by 11-point numerical visual analog scale (VAS)and 5-Likert scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Skin problem on the site of tourniquet application
secondary_outcome.description: It includes ecchymosis, bullae formation and skin necrosis.
It includes deep vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism which are symptomatic and diagnosed by confirmative test, such as CT angiogram.

arm_group.description: The patients in this group will undertake total knee arthroplasty under conventional tourniquet pressure, which will be set as the pressure added by 150mmHg on the last systolic blood pressure just before tourniquet inflation.

The patients in this group will undertake total knee arthroplasty under low tourniquet pressure, which will be set as the pressure added by 120mmHg on the last systolic blood pressure just before tourniquet inflation.

intervention.description: Tourniquet pressure set as 120mmHg above the systolic blood pressure just before tourniquet inflation
Tourniquet pressure set as 150mmHg above the systolic blood pressure just before tourniquet inflation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The patients undergoing total knee arthroplasty
Exclusion Criteria:
- Systolic blood pressure measured at ward > 200mmHg
- Thigh circumference > 78cm
- Anesthesia other than spinal anesthesia
- Simultaneous bilateral total knee arthroplasty
- The patients who disagreed the enrollment of this study
